Package index

Class Index

  • java.lang.Object
    • index.Index

  • public class Index
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    luca This class implements an Index. This Index allows to being manipulated by user, who decide which Documents/Directories adding/removing.

    • Method Summary

      This method removes a document from the index, given its position into the index

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getIndex

        public static Index getIndex​()
        This method makes the Index class a singleton, allocating uniqueIndex as the only instance of this class, and returning it. By default, VectorSpaceModel is the model applied to it.
        Returns:
        Index as a uniqueIndex

      • getIndex

        public static Index getIndex​(org.apache.lucene.search.similarities.Similarity sim)
        This method allows to create index specifying what similarity has to be set. When constructor is called, simUsed define the model to use for similarity.
        Parameters:
        sim - is the similarity to set, not applied if uniqueIndex is yet created
        Returns:
        Index

      • setSimilarity

        public void setSimilarity​(org.apache.lucene.search.similarities.Similarity sim,
                          boolean reload)
        To change similarity used by an index, this has to be re-initialized, losing its content. To prevent this, reload can be set to true, saving content of index in a temporary Index (tempIndex) and reloading them after re-initializing. This is done only if similarity of index is different by the passed one.
        Parameters:
        sim - is the similarity to set
        reload - is a boolean to save index in a temporary save and reload it's content after reset

      • resetIndex

        public void resetIndex​()
        This method removes the previous index and closes its tools. Then it makes a new Index, reallocating new tools. This is the fastest and easiest way to "clear" totally an index from its entries.

      • saveIndex

        public void saveIndex​(java.lang.String saveFile)
        This method write all documents path to the target file, as clear text.
        Parameters:
        saveFile - is the path of the saveFile (plain text) to load (each line is the path to the document)

      • loadIndex

        public void loadIndex​(java.lang.String saveFile)
        This method, contrary to saveIndex, load documents in Index by a save file that contains a list of them. It doesn't overwrite index content, only adds documents to index.
        Parameters:
        saveFile - is the file containing documents to be loaded.

      • addDocument

        public void addDocument​(java.lang.String docPath)
        This method is used to create and to add a document to the index.
        Parameters:
        docPath - is a concatenation of path and name of a document (for example "doc/Lucene.pdf")

      • getDocument

        public org.apache.lucene.document.Document getDocument​(int index)
        Returns a document giving corresponding index.
        Parameters:
        index - of the document to return
        Returns:
        document object from index

      • removeDocument

        public void removeDocument​(int index)
        This method removes a document from the index, given its position into the index
        Parameters:
        index - is index of document to remove

      • getSize

        public int getSize​()
        Returns the number of documents stored in index.
        Returns:
        size of the index

      • submitQuery

        public java.util.LinkedList<Hit> submitQuery​(java.lang.String query,
                                             java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> fields,
                                             Model m,
                                             boolean print)
        This method requires a string representing user query, a LinkedList of Strings containing fields in which searching, the Model instance used to parse query, a boolean print to get query and results to be printed or not
        Parameters:
        query - is the query String
        fields - are fields on which search
        m - is the model to use for parsing query
        print - allows query and results printing
        Returns:
        a list of "Hit", where Hit is a custom class that contains a document and its score for that query
